ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Player wipe on Test
ygData.msgSnippet: Hate to play the devils advocate here, but maybe verant planned that solB stuff just to see how greedy everyone who was supposed to be *testing* the game
ygData.messageBody:
Hate to play the devils advocate here, but maybe verant planned that solB stuff just to see how greedy everyone who was supposed to be *testing* the game actually was? I mean, how good of a tester are you if you're exploiting a bug for 10 hours?
----- Original Message -----
From: Sylly Songsynger
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, June 21, 2000 9:36 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Player wipe on Test


Read between the lines below. I am hope when Lyrnia recovers from the total
state of shock - can fill us in with more gory details. In the meantime
here are some rumors I heard.

----- Original Message -----
From: "Gordon Hughes" <ghughes@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 21, 2000 8:13 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Player wipe on Test


> Ouch! :(
>
> In case some of you don't know, the entire player-base on the Test server
> was wiped yesterday.

!Ouch!

> Verant's reason being they wanted a clean slate to
> conduct ongoing tests.

<cough>BULLSHIT!<cough>

I heard that all mobs (many mobs? some mobs? GK's in Solb?) started dropping
Naggy/Vox loots - heh!

> I can only imagine what it must feel like to have built up a character
over
> the last year to have it wiped, and with little or no warning from what
I've
> heard.
>
> Lyrnia, you had a high level Bard on test, didn't you?
>
> I read on the Gameplay board this morning that Brad is taking suggestions
> on:
>
> 1) Reinstating characters but wiping out all their items.

Heard that they tried a load from tape and it brought back all the GM Buffed
& Itemized Level 60 chars from the Kunark beta as well. (more on that
below.) It restored every character recently created not just current
characters or something like that. On live servers they are able to restore
chars from tapes they keep. Not sure of the current cycle but about 6
months ago a friend got restored but the save point was from a few days
previous.

> I can understand their reasons for going ahead with the wipe, but it still
> stinks nonetheless.

It stinks - big time! Think about this happening on a live server or on all
live servers. I guess that is why they have a test server but it also points
out (yet again) the woefull lack of professionalism in Verant's procedures.
Are they no more than a bunch of "Cowboy Coders" ??? They can't even do
reliable tape back-ups??? Here is a valuable resource - test server and the
testers. The design of the game is such that you need to invest large
amounts of time to get to high levels. To go for a year and allow folks to
build their chars and test the new things without adequate protection is
simply gross negligence. To say "its just a test environment and you knew
that you could be pwiped at any given time without notice..." is just
legalise B.S. to cover their ass for their own incompetance. I can see that
level of error allowable on in-house, alpha level environment or even
closed beta. To have run the closed beta on the test server - was a huge
error on their part (thank you 20-20 hind site) but it smacks of their
"penny-wise, pound-foolish" attitude.

If the test server and the testers there are truly valuable resources, then
they should have had adequate safeguards in place to allow them to recover
their test world to a previous save point. This really hurts they
credibility and shows what little respect they have for testers who are
helping them. Imagine how they regard the ones who merely play the game.

Sylly

p.s. I heard that in the beta GM's would "buff" their friends (testers) -
make them level 60, give them any weps, any armor, and then they would try
stuff. I heard that folks saw these guys in this uber-garb but with weps
equipped in the wrong hands and stuff. When they (GM twinkies) tried to
fight mobs, they got owned. But not cuz of their gear that was for sure.
They just did not know what they were doing: ie "could not fight their way
out of a paper bag, much less clear the way to Trak's lair."

But that is merely rumors.
